channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Judge extends deadline for deportation flight details as DOJ continues to resist
item.description: The Justice Department is fighting not to divulge more information about flights that deported alleged gang members to El Salvador. The federal judge ...

item.title: Trump admin. cuts funding for program that tracked Ukrainian children abducted by Russia
item.description: NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks with Rep. Greg Landsman, a lawmaker who signed a letter to Secretary of State Marco Rubio asking whether a database of Ukrain...

item.title: These scientists are building a cat database to understand why they act like that
item.description: The project, called Darwin's Cats, aims to enhance our understanding of feline behavior and genetics.

item.title: Trump administration extends opioid emergency as fentanyl deaths drop
item.description: U.S. Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. says the Trump administration will continue to treat opioid overdoses as a "national security" emergency e...

item.title: As U.S. foreign aid programs grind to a halt, African health leaders look for a silver lining
item.description: Chad has one of the highest rates of maternal mortality. A group of midwives helped but now their jobs are on the line — one of many cases where count...

item.title: Violent attacks on Tesla dealerships spike as Musk takes prominent role in Trump White House
item.description: Attacks on property carrying the logo of Elon Musk’s electric-car company are cropping up from coast to coast and even overseas.

item.title: Zelensky says lasting peace achievable this year as he and Trump hail 'positive' call
item.description: The US president says peace efforts are "very much on track", a day after Russia's president declined to agree a full ceasefire.

item.title: Hungary bans LGBTQ+ Pride marches
item.description: The move from Orban's conservative government is the latest in a crackdown on the LGBT community.

item.title: Guilty verdict in Feeding Our Future founder's fraud trial
item.description: A jury delivered a string of guilty verdicts Wednesday afternoon in what prosecutors call the largest pandemic fraud case in the country.

item.title: Latest forecast with major storm system developing in central U.S.
item.description: A risk for tornados and blizzard conditions is taking shape in the central U.S. as a major storm system moves across the country. CBS News Philadelphi...

item.title: UN says worker killed in Gaza as Israeli air strikes resume
item.description: Israel's military denies attacking the Deir al-Balah compound, after the Hamas-run health ministry blamed an Israeli strike.

item.title: Judge denies bid to stop DOGE's efforts to take over U.S. Institute of Peace
item.description: A group of five former Institute of Peace board members are challenging DOGE's efforts targeting the U.S. Institute of Peace.

item.title: Federal Reserve holds interest rates steady, but trims growth outlook
item.description: Fed Chair Jerome Powell cites "high uncertainty" around the impact of Trump administration tariffs on key trading partners.

item.title: 'It's him, it's him!' - Mother spots son deported from US in mega-prison footage
item.description: Some relatives of accused and deported gang members say their sons have been wrongly swept up in a Trump administration crackdown.

item.title: Mar 19: CBS News 24/7, 1pm ET
item.description: President Trump says phone call with Zelenskyy was "very good"; Scammers take over Google Maps.

item.title: Blizzard conditions hit the Midwest while wildfires and tornadoes threaten Central US
Arizona executes a man who murdered his girlfriend’s ex-husband
Erdogan rival arrested days before becoming presidential candidate
item.description: Protests erupt in the streets of Istanbul after the move, despite a four-day ban on demonstrations.
